stimulusHtml: Respond to all parts of the question.

features.html:
Country A and Country B produce the same two products, hammocks and looms. Country A can produce a maximum of 60 hammocks or 40 looms, while Country B can produce a maximum of 40 hammocks or 20 looms.

  1. What is the opportunity cost to produce a loom in terms of hammocks in Country A?

  2. Which country, if either, has a comparative advantage in producing looms? Explain.

  3. Internationally, if 1 loom is traded for 1.75 hammocks, who will benefit from trading: Country A only, Country B only, both countries, or neither country?

  4. Assume there is international trade.

    1. Can a country produce beyond its production possibilities curve (PPC) ?

    2. Can a country consume beyond its PPC?
